item.title: Josh Shapiro Writes That Harris Team Asked if He Had Ever Been an Israeli Agent
item.description: A new memoir by Gov. Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania goes into detail about his experience being vetted to be former Vice President Kamala Harris’s running mate in 2024. ]]>

item.title: In Minneapolis, a Pattern of Misconduct Toward Protesters
item.description: Federal agents hold down a protester outside the Whipple federal building in Minneapolis on Jan. 11. ]]>

item.title: Before Urban Raids, Border Patrol Tested Tactics in California Farm Country
item.description:
Just before President Trump took office, Border Patrol agents led by Gregory Bovino arrested immigrants in Kern County using the same playbook later seen in places like Chicago and Minneapolis. Then a federal judge ordered them to stop.

]]>

item.title: Texas Schools Wait as Law on Ten Commandments Reaches Appeals Court
item.description: On Tuesday, the 17 active judges on the generally conservative Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals in New Orleans will hear arguments over the Texas state law mandating the display of the Ten Commandments. ]]>

item.title: Search of Reporter’s Home Tests Law With Roots in a Campus Paper’s Suit

item.title: Prominent Catholic Clerics Denounce U.S. Foreign Policy

item.title: Read the Texts Between Trump and Norway’s Prime Minister

item.title: Federal Reserve Inquiry Clouds Trump’s Supreme Court Bid to Oust Lisa Cook
item.description:
The court is set to hear Ms. Cook’s case challenging her firing as the Justice Department investigates Jerome H. Powell, the central bank chair.

]]>
